text: - My name is Don Southard

and I'm the Director of
Customer Solutions Managers
in what's called our West area.
I've been with AWS for 10 years.

I was one of the first
solutions architects
hired in California.
I worked my way from that to SA manager

and then now I'm a director
for one of our largest groups.

The biggest surprises for
me over the last 10 years

are the things I've done, the
customers I've worked with,
and just being able to share with them
the recipe for innovation that we think
is gonna benefit them.

Using the cloud, it's
just been really amazing.

And so I've just done things
I never thought I would do.
It's kind of hard to explain.

I sometimes, you know, summarize
it when I talk to people

and say, I think I'm
about two inches taller
than when I first started.
If I look at what we've done
like with customers and life sciences,

they're able to do experiments
in the matter of days
with relatively small investments.

And if those fail that's okay,
'cuz they're going to fail.
Things are going to fail,

but you see results and
people take more risks

and they take more chances
on new products and services.
So I think that that excites me.

And usually when I kind
of share that with people
that excites them too

'cause they feel like they're
gonna really have an impact.
(upbeat music)
